RIP @repjohnlewis. Let us all stir up good trouble for what is right and remember ‚ÄúThe vote is the most powerful nonviolent tool we have.‚Äù ~ John Lewis

Drawing by @cnoxon from his book Good Trouble: Lessons from the Civil Rights Playbook

#RIP #restinpower #johnlewis #goodtrouble #goodtroublebook #civilrightsmovement #blacklivesmatter

Let‚Äôs revisit our friend @cnoxon and Good Trouble, Lessons From the Civil Rights Movement. The Rev. Dr. Otis Moss 111 says it best,‚Äù Our nation needs Good Trouble,‚Äù For perspective, placement, vision of the road traveled and the road we are traveling. @noxonpics @abramsbooks #goodtroublebook #civilrights #civilrightsactivist #artjournalism #civilrightsmovement #bookstagram #historybook #americanhistory #socialjustice #powertothepeople

Yeah the honors and tributes are everywhere today, but the thing is: John Lewis was the real thing, a living embodiment of deep feeling & conviction & hope. Entirely free of cynicism, he was true to his vision of a beloved community from his days as a student activist to his years in Congress. Rename the bridge in Selma, restore the Voting Rights Act, work to reform & dismantle racist police and go make GOOD TROUBLE...

#goodtrouble #goodtroublebook #johnlewisgoodtrouble

Musa‚Äôs friend Chris Noxon has just released his book that we have been waiting for since he donated two illustrations from it to our art sale last year. Good Trouble is a very important book for these times. Amazing interviews with pivotal players during the Civil Rights movement of the sixties. Chris illustrated and has written an essential read. His next three stops on his book tour are :
1/17 San Francisco, Books Inc.
1/23 Seattle, University Book Store 
1/24 Los Angeles, Chevalier on Larchmont @noxonpics @cnoxon #goodtroublebook #civilrights #civilrightsmovement #newbooks #newbook #newbookalert #illustratedbook #bookreading #bookopening

Two years ago at La Guardia on a reporting trip for ‚ÄúGood Trouble,‚Äù I happened to be sitting next to this guy when someone dropped an iced coffee on the floor next to us, splattering our pants (and his guide dog!). We got to talking while sopping up the mess - and it just so happened that Rev RK Smith is pastor at Dexter Avenue Church in Birmingham, the church where Martin Luther King kicked off the bus boycott. Also, his wife Avis grew up with the King family and babysat for their daughter. ‚ÄúCrazy coincidence, I said. ‚ÄúGod has a plan for us,‚Äù said RK. His guidance, insight and unflagging optimism were a huge inspiration for the book, and for me. This week we met up for oysters and conversation and I was  reminded again how indebted I am to the work and wisdom of people whose names and stories are left out of standard histories. 
#goodtroublebook
New & noteworthy! #nytimesbooks #goodtroublebook #anactualreviewwoildvebeenbetterbutgratefulforanything

On this pub day for ‚ÄúGood Trouble,‚Äù here‚Äôs a page from vacation journal on which I idly played with those little plastic pots from the kids‚Äô paint-by-numbers set (was supposed to paint an owl). Also, did some thinking  about the point of protest among likeminded people and made notes on the heroic, Quaker, queer, pacifist bon vivant Bayard Rustin. Ended up scanning this page and using the image on the opening page of Good Trouble, with words from his book ‚ÄúStrategies for Freedom‚Äù: .
‚ÄúWe need in every community a group of angelic troublemakers. Our power is in our ability to make things unworkable. The only weapon is our bodies and we need to tuck them in places so wheels don‚Äôt turn.‚Äù .
So excited to launch these words and pictures into the world today... .
#goodtroublebook #goodtrouble #bayardrustin #civilrightsmovement

Thanks @cmurnick and @nymag!

#printnotdead #mugshots #goodtroublebook

Hey LA friends: this weekend is the LA Times Festival of Books and you should totally go. It‚Äôs kind of the best version of the city: all the curious, literate, open-hearted people are there. And I‚Äôm doing a panel at 10 am Saturday with some serious heavyweights - a MacArthur Genius from Stanford, a historian who worked in civil rights in Mississippi in 1964 and a local organizer with, um, 30 years of experience in progressive protests. But hey: I draw pretty pictures! 
#latimesfestivalofbooks #goodtroublebook

May Congressman John Lewis rest in power knowing that we're upholding his legacy to "get into some trouble, necessary trouble, GOOD TROUBLE."

I‚Äôm a huge fan of the podcast ‚ÄúUnorthodox,‚Äù the smart, funny, irreverent weekly chat show about the many ways of being and doing Jewishness, hosted by the snappy journalist trio of preppy dad Mark, Israeli-contrarian Liel and badass Millennial Stephanie. Today they posted an interview with me about ‚ÄúGood Trouble,‚Äù essential lessons from civil rights and Oscar‚Äôs Jews Your Own Adventure bar mitzvah. (Stick around for a chat with Bernard-Henri L√©vi and a great segment on circumcision). Link in bio. #unorthodox #nachas #goodtroublebook
Abraham Heschel pic & quote from ‚ÄúGood Trouble,‚Äù reprinted in new Paper Brigade, the gorgeous lit magazine from the menches at the @jewishbookcouncil #goodtroublebook #heschel #praywithyourfeet

‚ÄúGood Trouble‚Äù sketchbook outtake #5: MLK‚Äôs boyhood home in Atlanta, now a National Parks tourist destination. Weirdly affecting, as these kind of places sometimes are - hard not to feel the presence of history, the extraordinary energy that took shape in this place. Then again, it‚Äôs just a house with a gift shop where the sitting room once was.
.

#mlk #goodtroublebook #drawingonpaper 
#standforsomething
#letyourvoicebeheard
#socialjustice
#votingmatters
#powertothepeople #civilrights
#civilrightsmovement
#civilrightsactivist

Yes he got the national holiday and the Nobel and the 900 street names, but lest we forget MLK was a radical who was bugged by the FBI and reviled by conservatives as a pinko agitator. He was also a God squad spiritualist whose faith had everything to do with his antiracist, anti military, pro people politics. From ‚ÄúStride Toward Freedom‚Äù:
.
‚ÄúThe universe is on the side of justice. The believer in nonviolence has deep faith in the future. This faith is another reason why the nonviolent resister can accept suffering without retaliation. For he knows that in his struggle for justice he has COSMIC COMPANIONSHIP. It is true that there are devout believers in nonviolence who find it difficult to believe in a personal God. But even these persons believe in the existence of some creative force that works for universal wholeness. Whether we call it an unconscious process, an impersonal Brahman, or a Personal Being of matchless power and infinite love, there is a creative force in this universe that works to bring the disconnected aspects of reality into a harmonious whole.‚Äù

Yes to standing up for one another. Yes to mutuality. Yes to integration.
.
We're honoring Martin Luther King Jr. today and everyday by stirring up some Good Trouble. #GoodTroubleBook

You know that Emma Goldman quote about ‚Äúif I can‚Äôt dance I don‚Äôt want to be in your revolution‚Äù? I looked it up and she never said it. The real story (quoted here from her biography) is so much better. 
I‚Äôm on the road talking about ‚ÄúGood Trouble‚Äù and the lessons of civil rights - and one of the primary ones is BRING THE JOY. Social justice and fighting oppression and working for democracy can be such serious business - the mood doesn‚Äôt have to be. Let‚Äôs show the other side where the party is.... .
#emmagoldman #joy #goodtroublebook #inspiredaily

‚ÄúGood Trouble‚Äù sketchbook outtake #4: 16th St Baptist Church in Birmingham, bombed by ‚ÄúDynamite Bob‚Äù and four of his KKK cronies in 1963. Four schoolgirls died. It was 14 years before he faced charges. Today it stands across the street from the Civil Rights Institute. .
.
#goodtroublebook #16thstreetbaptistchurch

Do you know how to create #GoodTrouble? üó£üá∫üá∏ @noxonpics debuts this inspirational, illustrated guide on how you can use lessons from the civil rights movement to create positive change for the future. All author proceeds from this book are being donated to @popdemoc, a nonprofit advocacy group that is devoted to racial justice, health care, and poverty issues.
.
For information on how you can cause good trouble, visit our website at the link in our profile.

‚ÄúGood Trouble‚Äù sketchbook outtake #1 - Jo Ann Robinson was a divorced English professor in Montgomery Alabama when Rosa Parks was arrested. She and a group of friends got to work, staying up all night writing, copying (on the English dept. mimeograph machine) and then distributing a call for a bus boycott. Rosa Parks deserves reverence for sitting; Jo Ann Robinson should be remembered for MOVING. 
#goodtroublebook
